channel.title: c14 on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in c14 on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 112, Psalm 6, 8-10, 14, 16, 19, 21
item.description: Psalm 6 is a cry for help to God during suffering and a statement of hope in the steadfast love of God.

item.title: Day 101, 1 Samuel 13-14
item.description: Saul goes to war against the Philistines. However, increasing defections begin to make Saul very nervous. As a result, instead of waiting for Samuel to come, he offers the sacrifice unlawfully.

item.title: Day 94, Judges 13-15
item.description: The birth of Samson was heralded by the angel of the LORD, who appeared first to Manoah’s wife and then to both of them at Manoah’s request.

item.title: Day 85, Joshua 12-15
item.description: Moses defeated the kings east of the Jordan. The land there was given to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

item.title: Day 75, Deuteronomy 14-16
item.description: Moses tells the Israelites about the laws regarding clean and unclean food again. He reminds them that they are to live in the way God commands them because they are a holy people to God, and God has chosen them as a treasured possession.

item.title: Day 60, Numbers 14-15, Psalm 90
item.description: On hearing the report of the spies, the people rebel and wish to return to Egypt. Moses, Aaron, Joshua, and Caleb were greatly grieved, for they believed that God would deliver the inhabitants of Canaan into their land.

item.title: Day 48, Leviticus 14-15
item.description: God gives laws regarding bodily discharges and the cleansing of lepers and houses. Throughout the entire passage, God makes it very clear that there is a tight relationship between one’s physical state and spiritual state.

item.title: Day 34, Exodus 13-15
item.description: The Feast of Unleavened bread was established so that the people of Israel may remember their deliverance from their Egyptian oppressors, for they left in haste.

item.title: Day 16, Genesis 12-15
item.description: God tells Abram to leave the land he is living in and go to a land that God will show him.

item.title: Day 7, Job 14-16
item.description: Job proceeds to talk about the pointlessness of life, since all men will eventually die. If that is so, then it makes sense for Job to want to bring his case before God.
